Parasite on mussels Mytilus edulis, Crassostrea gigas, and Mytilus galloprovincialis; use occurrence records to map tolerances

Has been reported in Humboldt Bay, CA where summer salinities range from 31 to 35 ppt; Fofonoff et al. 2003 say "nearly full salinity" so we use lower limit of Humboldt Bay range (approximate range from Lomeli 2011, M.Sc. thesis Humboldt University)

WeekReprod: Larvae spend between 10-14 days in the water column (Duval 1963)
Larval development depends on temperature. Larvae settle within 60 days at 10C and 16-28 days at 12C. At 18C, time to sexual maturity is 33 days. See lit. review .docx for more information.
